meanings.definition: The state or quality of being coeval.
meanings.sent1: The coevalities of the two friends made their bond even stronger.
meanings.sent2: The coevalities of the siblings were evident in their shared memories.
meanings.sent3: The coevalities between the two puppies led to endless playtime together.
meanings.sent4: The coevalities of the old tree and the young sapling symbolized the circle of life.
meanings.sent5: The coevalities of the stars in the night sky created a sense of timelessness.

meanings.definition: The fact of being of the same age or date of origin.
meanings.sent1: Their coevalities in the class made them instant friends.
meanings.sent2: The coevalities of the artifacts helped archaeologists determine their historical context.
meanings.sent3: The coevalities of the vintage cars at the show sparked a lively debate among enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The coevalities of the ancient ruins and the modern city highlighted the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The coevalities of the coins in the collection shed light on the economic history of the region.
